intro: Cleistanthus myrianthus var. concinnus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
